question.text: Given below is a diagram related to sickle-cell anaemia, which provides immunity to malarial parasite. Identify X, Y and Z in the given diagram.

options.text: X - CAC ; Y - GTG ; Z - Val
X - CAC ; Y - GTG ; Z - Phe
X - GTG ; Y - CAC ; Z - Val
X - CAC ; Y - GTG ; Z - His

solution.text: Sickle cell anaemia is a severe hereditary form of anaemia in which a mutated form of haemoglobin distorts the red blood cells into a crescent shape. It is common among people of African descent. The mutation (transversion/single point mutation) causing sickle cell anaemia is a single nucleotide substitution (A to T) in the codon for amino acid 6. The change converts a glutamic acid codon (GAG) to a valine codon (GTG). The form of haemoglobin in persons with sickle cell anaemia is referred to as HbS.
